turns.content: What would cause a sharp pain on my left side just under my bottom rib when I try to take a deep breath or sneeze.

There are several possible causes for a sharp pain on the left side just under your bottom rib when you take a deep breath or sneeze. Some of the common causes include:

1. Pulled or strained muscles: The muscles between the ribs (intercostal muscles) can become strained or pulled, causing sharp pain when you take a deep breath or sneeze.
2. Rib injuries: A rib fracture, bruise or contusion can also cause sharp pain on the left side of the body when you breathe deeply or sneeze.
3. Pleurisy: Inflammation of the lining surrounding the lungs (pleura) can cause pain when you breathe deeply or cough.
4. Pneumonia: A bacterial or viral infection of the lungs can cause sharp pain on one side of the chest, which can worsen with deep breathing or coughing.
5. Costochondritis: Inflammation of the cartilage that connects the ribs to the breastbone can cause sharp pain on the left side of the chest.

If you are experiencing persistent or severe pain, you should seek medical attention from a healthcare provider to determine the cause of the pain and receive appropriate treatment.
